words.definition: When you become accustomed to something, you are in the habit of it.
words.example: Grandfather is accustomed to reading the newspaper every morning.

words.definition: To affirm is to say that something is true.
words.example: Using a graph, Malcolm affirmed the success of the company.

words.definition: If someone is astonished, they are very surprised or shocked.
words.example: I was astonished when he pulled the live rabbit out of his hat.

words.definition: To bang is to hit something to make a noise.
words.example: The drummer banged on his drum as he marched in the parade.

words.definition: A clan is a group of relatives or friends.
words.example: The Reed clan gathers for a family reunion every summer.

words.definition: When something is dim, it does not give out much light.
words.example: Working in a dim room is bad for your eyes.

words.definition: Emphasis is special importance or attention given to something.
words.example: The teacher placed emphasis on the importance of homework.

words.definition: A fable is a short story that teaches a lesson.
words.example: The Aesop's fables are famous around the world.

words.definition: A feast is a large meal for many people.
words.example: The king invited everyone to a grand feast.

words.definition: To glow is to make a soft light.
words.example: The fireflies glowed in the dark night.

words.definition: When something is hollow, it has an empty space inside.
words.example: The owl lived in a hollow tree.

words.definition: Instinct is the way that people and animals naturally act or feel.
words.example: Cats have a natural instinct to hunt mice.

words.definition: A joint is a place of the body where the bones meet, such as the knee.
words.example: Two bones come together at a joint.

words.definition: A leak is a hole that lets a liquid or gas pass through.
words.example: The pipe had a leak, so the floor was wet.

words.definition: A physician is a doctor.
words.example: The physician told me to rest for a few days.

words.definition: To sacrifice something is to give it up to get something else.
words.example: She sacrificed her free time to study for the exam.

words.definition: When something is stiff, it is hard to move or bend.
words.example: The new shoes were very stiff.

words.definition: To stroke is to move your hand gently over something.
words.example: She stroked the cat's soft fur.

words.definition: If something is tragic, it is very sad and involves death or suffering.
words.example: The news of the accident was tragic.

words.definition: A tune is a song or melody.
words.example: He whistled a happy tune.
